channel.title: Ai on CoderDojo Schöneweide
channel.description: Recent content in Ai on CoderDojo Schöneweide

item.title: Artificial Intelligence
item.description:
In the “Artificial Intelligence” workshop, participants explore how AI works and what this technology can be used for. Using the Monkey Game as an example, participants discover how AI “learns.” Then, with the help of the website Machine Learning for Kids they can train and experiment with AI themselves. The model can also be used in Scratch at the end.

Learning objectives:

  • Participants know what AI is.
  • Participants know how AI can be trained.
  • Participants are familiar with some applications of AI.

Participants will need:

item.title: Hello Bot, how are you?
item.description:
In the online workshop “Hello Bot, how are you?” participants will gain insight into how to program chatbots. Chatbots are programs capable of conversing with a user. Participants can choose to use either Scratch or Python.

Depending on the participants’ progress, when using Scratch, they can also utilize the “Text-to-Speech” extension and create their own blocks (also known as “functions” or “subroutines”).

Learning objectives:

  • Participants understand what a chatbot is.
  • Participants can make the computer say something.
  • Participants can query and use user input.
  • Participants can use conditions to respond to user input.

Participants will need:
